#Text=Wikinews interviews Richard H. Clark , independent candidate for US President
#Text=Tuesday , February 19 , 2008

#Text=While nearly all cover of the 2008 Presidential election has focused on the Democratic and Republican candidates , the race for the White House also includes independents and third party candidates .
#Text=These parties represent a variety of views that may not be acknowledged by the major party platforms .
#Text=As a non-partisan news source , Wikinews has impartially reached out to these candidates , throughout the campaign .
#Text=The most recent of our interviews is Gaithersburg , Maryland 's Richard H. Clark ( b. 1960 ) , a senior software engineer and member of MENSA .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why do you want to be President ?
#Text=It 's not a matter of wanting to be .
#Text=I do n't want to .
#Text=There is a need .
#Text=The corruption in the administration has become astronomical .
#Text=The government must be brought back to the people .
#Text=I can do that .
#Text=Have you ever run for political office before ?
#Text=No , I have not .
#Text=Have you ever been a member of a political party , other than the one you 're currently in ?
#Text=No , I have not .
#Text=I have always been a registered Independent .
#Text=Have you ever campaigned for another political candidate ?
#Text=No , I have not .
#Text=But I 've become fond of the involvement now .
#Text=I will campaign for candidates in the future .
#Text=What is your current job ?
#Text=I 'm a Technical Team Lead at a small software company .
#Text=We do real-time embedded Linux work , re-assembling protocols for data analysis and critical information leakage .
#Text=We are the undisputed leaders in our field , in no small part due to my contributions .
#Text=What skills or ideas do you bring from this position , or previous positions , that will benefit the Oval Office ?
#Text=I have an open mind .
#Text=I do not suffer from NIH ( Not-Invented-Here ) .
#Text=What I bring is the ability to unify and use the best that everyone on my team has to offer .
#Text=I am a problem solver who knows that the best way to solve problems is to work with and listen to everyone involved .
#Text=Being a member of MENSA helps as well .
#Text=Obviously , the next American President and his or her administration will face many diverse issues .
#Text=But if you were to narrow identify the three most important issues , what would they be ?
#Text=How will you address these issues ?
#Text=Only three ? 1000 words ?
#Text=That 's difficult ...
#Text=Priority #1 - Free Trade .
#Text=This is the primary cause of our loss of jobs , our dwindling paychecks , our loss of health care , and so many other problems .
#Text=We simply cannot compete directly with third world labor at a dollar a day .
#Text=Our losses in the manufacturing sector will eventually bring down the economy .
#Text=The loss of generated revenue causes problems everywhere , for everyone .
#Text=Priority #2 - Corruption .
#Text=Almost none of our elected representatives actually works for us any more .
#Text=Lobbyists and special interests run the country .
#Text=Short-term greed rules the day .
#Text=This is no way to run a country .
#Text=I will clamp down hard on lobbyists and special interests .
#Text=I will change the election laws to affect permanent solutions to the underlying causes of corruption .
#Text=Priority #3 - Illegal Immigration and Foreign Policy .
#Text=First order of business is to remove our troops from the Middle East , and place them along our southern border to shut down Illegal Immigration .
#Text=Second order is to establish non-oil economic ties with the Middle East to help build their economies .
#Text=This puts a damper on Terrorism , in that people who are not starving to death , who are educated , do not feed terrorism .
#Text=There are so many issues .
#Text=They will all be addressed .
#Text=One thing to remember , is that it is not just me .
#Text=My staff will be addressing numerous issues simultaneously .
#Text=Having intelligent , dedicated staff is crucial to a good presidency .
#Text=This , the staff-building , is being done as I write .
#Text=I have contact with many great , highly-qualifed people .
#Text=Campaigning for the American presidency is one of the most expensive exercises in the world .
#Text=How do you deal with the cost and fundraising ?
#Text=Internet .
#Text=Networking with other candidates .
#Text=Organizing special events .
#Text=Relationship building .
#Text=There is no way I can win this election alone .
#Text=None of us can .
#Text=We all know that .
#Text=I have been in contact with numerous other candidates , and we are working to get the attention of the press .
#Text=Once we have their attention , it is my belief that Americans are starving for a viable alternative to the GOP/DEM parties .
#Text=The momentum should build on its own .
#Text=Do you have a running mate yet ?
#Text=Who are they ?
#Text=What are you looking for in a running mate ?
#Text=No running mate as yet .
#Text=What I 'm looking for is intelligence , honesty dedication , and the kahoonas to kick me in the butt if I start to stray .
#Text=And , quite frankly , after talking to quite a number of Third Party and Independent candidates , there is a lot of that out there !
#Text=The choice will actually be rather difficult .
#Text=There are a lot of great VPs out there .
#Text=That 's part of the problem .
#Text=There are too many good candidates , and we need to narrow the field down a little and all get behind just a few .
#Text=Can you win the 2008 Presidential election ?
#Text=Me win ? Perhaps .
#Text=Although not for not being perfect for the job and a great representative of the people .
#Text=Rather , my social and presentation skills are a littly " iffy " .
#Text=I 'm working on it though , and am not ready to give up just yet .
#Text=I 'm persistent if anything .
#Text=Can any third party or independent candidate ever win ?
#Text=I 'm working on it , doing the best I can to make sure that happens .
#Text=So , yes .
#Text=I believe so .
#Text=I hope so .
#Text=America is doomed to become a second-rate has-been of a country if we do n't topple the GOP/DEM corruption machine very soon .
#Text=If you ca n't make it into the Oval Office , who would you prefer seeing taking the presidency ?
#Text=Any of the Independent or Third Party candidates .
#Text=Anyone not associated with the GOP/DEM power structure .
#Text=What should the American people keep in mind , when heading to the polls this November ?
#Text=Do n't waste your vote on the GOP/DEM parties .
#Text=Do your homework and find an Independent or Third Party candidate that you can support .
#Text=Voting GOP or DEM is simply a green light for them , to continue screwing the country for every penny they can squeeze out of us .
#Text=Please , vote Independent or Third Party .
